page.title: 10Cadbury Chocolate, Keynsham.
page.content: Cadbury's factory in Keynsham was opened in 1936. The factory is called Somerdale. Before it became Cadbury's the company was called Fry's. (It is now called Cadbury-Schweppes.) They make chocolate bars and some sweets. In one year they make about 50,000 tonnes of confectionary. Somerdale is in between the River Avon and the main railway line from Bristol to London. The site covers 228 acres. You enter the factory along a long peaceful drive shaded by trees. In front of the factory is a large sports field and social club for the 1729 employees. Also by the entrance are the remains of a Roman Villa. Keynsham Carnival procession ends at Cadbury's Ground and there is a fair. A large Cad- bury's sign is lit up every evening. It is a famous local landmark. How- ever local people still call it Fry's.
